nl.naturalis.nda.elasticsearch.load

Class ETLStatistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.nda.elasticsearch.load.ETLStatistics

  • public class ETLStatistics
extends Object
    A Java bean maintaining a set of running totals for an ETL program.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Field Detail

      • badInput

        public int badInput
        The number of times that the source data could not be parsed into a record (usually during extraction phase). This is useful when processing CSV files, where a raw line may not be parsable into a CSVRecord. It is not very useful when processing XML files, because these are parsed as a whole into a DOM tree.

      • recordsProcessed

        public int recordsProcessed
        The number of records processed by the import program.

      • recordsSkipped

        public int recordsSkipped
        The number of records that contain data that are not meant to be imported by the import program. For example the taxa.txt file in CoL DwCA files containes both taxa and synonyms. The taxon importer only needs to process the taxa in that file.
        recordsSkipped + recordsRejected + recordsRejected = recordsProcessed

      • recordsRejected

        public int recordsRejected
        The number of records that failed some validation. Validation is done for the record as a whole, rather than for the object(s) extracted from it.

      • recordsAccepted

        public int recordsAccepted
        The number of records that made it to the transformation phase. Simply the number of records that were neither skipped nor rejected.
        recordsSkipped + recordsRejected + recordsAccepted = recordsProcessed

      • objectsProcessed

        public int objectsProcessed
        The number of objects processed by the import program. Note that one record may contain multiple objects. For example, one line in a Brahms CSV export may contain multiple images.
        objectsSkipped + objectsRejected + objectsIndexed = objectsProcessed

      • objectsSkipped

        public int objectsSkipped
        The number of objects that are not meant to be imported by the import program.

      • objectsRejected

        public int objectsRejected
        The number of objects that failed some validation.

      • objectsIndexed

        public int objectsIndexed
        The number of objects that made it to ElasticSearch.

      • objectsAccepted

        public int objectsAccepted
        The number of objects that passed validation

    • Constructor Detail

      • ETLStatistics

        public ETLStatistics()

    • Method Detail

      • setUseObjectsAccepted

        public void setUseObjectsAccepted(boolean b)
        Determines which counter to use for successfully transformed data. Ordinarily the following rule applies: objectsSkipped + objectsRejected + objectsIndexed = objectsProcessed . In this case objectsIndexed is the number of successfully transformed data. The transformer keeps track of objectsSkipped and objectsRejected while the loader keeps track of objectsIndexed. ETL programs for which this rule applies don't need to keep track of the objectsAccepted counter. However, if a data source is only used to add children (nested objects) to an already existing parent document, this rule no longer applies. The rule that applies then is: objectsSkipped + objectsRejected + objectsAccepted = objectsProcessed . In this case the transformer provides all three statistics and the number of indexations is more or less meaningless. If a data source provides 10 children for a particular parent document, the parent document will be re-indexed anywhere between 1 and 10 times during the course of the program, depending on how far apart the CSV/XML records containing the children were (if they all came one after another in the data source, they are added all at once to the parent document, resulting in just one index request for 10 child records).
        Parameters:
        b -

      • isUseObjectsAccepted

        public boolean isUseObjectsAccepted()
        Whether or not to use the objectsAccepted counter in stead of the objectsIndexed counter.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        setUseObjectsAccepted(boolean)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset all counters

      • add

        public void add(ETLStatistics other)
        Add the counters from the specified statistics object to this statistics object.
